comments.author: Yuri Z.
comments.text: ## Code Review: Homepage Screenshots + Performance Polish ### Summary Clean, focused changeset that replaces placeholder text with real product screenshots and adds performance attributes to all images. The changes are well-scoped and the test updates match the HTML changes. ### Verdict: **Approve** (with minor observations) --- ### What's good 1. **Placeholder removal is complete** — both product cards now use real `.webp` screenshots instead of text-only figcaptions. This directly addresses the trust/UX goal. 2. **Performance attributes are thorough** — every `` now has `loading="lazy"`, `decoding="async"`, and explicit `width`/`height`. This prevents layout shift (CLS) and is the right approach for a static site. 3. **Test coverage follows the changes** — the required-text list was updated, and a new forbidden-text block ensures placeholders can't silently return. Good defensive testing. 4. **WebP-only image delivery** — `.gitignore` adding `/.images/` suggests source/intermediate images are kept out of the repo while only optimized WebP assets ship. Correct pattern. --- ### Minor observations (non-blocking) **1. Duplicate image in product card + proof section** Both the SlidesLab product card and the "Generation Status (variants view)" proof card use `slideslab-generation-status.webp`. Same for Tube2Web's `tube2web-creator-dashboard-grid.webp`. This is intentional (card hero + detail section), but worth confirming the visual intent — users will see the same image twice on scroll. **2. Tall image aspect ratio** `slideslab-recent-generations-dashboard.webp` is declared as `900×2592` — nearly 3:1 portrait. On desktop this will render very tall inside `.proof-card`. Verify that `max-height` or `object-fit` in CSS constrains this reasonably, especially on wide viewports. **3. Test assertion specificity** The test checks for `width="1600"` and `height="921"` as raw strings, which will match any image with those dimensions (not specifically the product card images). If a future image happens to share those dimensions, the test won't catch a missing product screenshot. Low risk for a small page, but worth noting. **4. No `fetchpriority` on above-the-fold content** If either product card is visible on initial load (before scroll), `loading="lazy"` may actually delay the hero screenshot. Consider `fetchpriority="high"` and removing `loading="lazy"` for the first visible image. This is a refinement, not a regression. --- ### Checklist against acceptance criteria | Criteria | Status | |---|---| | Product cards use real screenshots | Pass — both cards have `.webp` images with descriptive alt text | | Image delivery is performance-oriented | Pass — `lazy`, `decoding=async`, explicit dimensions on all images | | No regression in legal/compliance content | Pass — privacy/terms checks unchanged in test suite | | Readable on mobile and desktop | No CSS changes in diff — existing responsive styles apply. Verify the 900×2592 image manually on mobile |

comments.author: Yuri Z.
comments.text: ## Review: wavelylabs-d3d Round 2 ### Observation checklist | Prior observation | Addressed? | Notes | |---|---|---| | Avoid duplicate visuals between product cards and proof section | **Yes** | Product cards now use distinct screenshots (`slideslab-pricing-page.webp`, `tube2web-public-generated-site.webp`) while proof section uses different shots (generation status, dashboard, import modal, etc.). The pricing-page image *does* appear in both the SlidesLab card and the proof "Pricing Page" card — but that's a minor overlap, not the original problem of placeholder-vs-real duplication. | | Handle tall portrait screenshot rendering | **Yes** | `.portrait-fit` class added with `object-fit: contain; object-position: top center; background: #0d1c29` and applied to the tall dashboard image (900×2592). | | Improve test specificity for product image slots | **Yes** | Tests now assert full `` attribute strings for both product cards, check for the `portrait-fit` class, and include a forbidden-text block rejecting old placeholder strings. | | Add above-the-fold fetch priority | **Yes** | First product image has `loading="eager" fetchpriority="high"`, second card correctly stays `loading="lazy"`. Tests verify these attributes. | ### New observations 1. **`.product-shot img` uses a bare `height: 250px` without `object-fit`** — The rule at `styles.css` sets a fixed height but doesn't specify `object-fit`, so landscape and portrait product screenshots will stretch or compress depending on their aspect ratio. The `.portrait-fit` utility solves this for the proof section, but the product cards don't use it. Consider adding `object-fit: cover` (or `contain`) to `.product-shot img` to prevent distortion as product images are swapped in the future. 2. **Duplicate image: `slideslab-pricing-page.webp` appears in both the product card and the proof section** — This is the exact class of issue observation #1 targeted. The SlidesLab product card and the "Pricing Page" proof card both render the same file. If this is intentional (proof section validates the card screenshot), it's acceptable but worth a comment or conscious decision. If not, one should be swapped to a different screenshot. 3. **Explicit `width`/`height` on all images is good, but `decoding="async"` test is non-specific** — The test line `"decoding=\"async\""` will match any image in the file, not specifically a product card. It doesn't break anything but doesn't add signal beyond the two full-attribute-string checks that follow it. Same applies to `"fetchpriority=\"high\""` and `"loading=\"eager\""`. These three lines are redundant given the specific assertions below them. ### Severity All three observations are **low severity** — no functional bugs, no accessibility regressions, no performance issues. The changes correctly address the four prior observations. Ship-ready as-is; the above are polish items for a future pass.

comments.text: ## Code Review: wavelylabs-d3d Round 3 ### Summary This round replaces placeholder text with real product screenshots, adds image performance attributes, and updates tests to enforce the new state. Clean, focused changes. ### Verdict: **Pass** — ship it. --- ### Observations **Positive** 1. **Placeholder removal is complete and enforced.** Both `mockshot` placeholders replaced with real `` tags, and the test now has a forbidden-text check preventing regression. Good defensive testing. 2. **Image performance attributes are thorough.** All images now carry `decoding="async"`, explicit `width`/`height` (CLS prevention), and the hero image correctly uses `loading="eager"` + `fetchpriority="high"` while gallery images use `loading="lazy"`. 3. **Portrait image handled well.** The `portrait-fit` class with `object-fit: contain` and `object-position: top center` is a clean solution for the tall dashboard screenshot. The dark background (`#0d1c29`) avoids letterbox flash. 4. **Responsive breakpoint covered.** The `@media` rule drops `.product-shot img` height from 250px to 210px, keeping cards proportionate on smaller screens. **Minor nits** (non-blocking) 1. **Duplicate image source, different context.** `tube2web-public-generated-site.webp` is used both as the product hero card image and again in the "Product Examples" gallery below. Not a bug — intentional reuse — but if a distinct hero crop ever becomes available, this is the spot to swap it. 2. **`.portrait-fit` is applied directly to `` but targets different specificity than `.product-shot img`.** Currently fine since the portrait image isn't inside `.product-shot`, but worth noting if the class is reused elsewhere in the future. 3. **Test string assertions are brittle by design** (checking raw HTML attribute strings like `width=\"1440\" height=\"810\"`). Acceptable for a small static site, but would become a maintenance burden at scale. Fine for now. No functional issues, no accessibility regressions, no security concerns. Tests pass. Ready to close and push.
